title: Interpret coefficient of determination for height

content.description: The height and age of each child in a random sample of children was recorded. The value of the correlation coefficient between height and age for the children in the sample was <math alttext="0.8" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>0.8</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>.
content.question: Based on the least-squares regression line created from the data to predict the height of a child based on age, which of the following is a correct statement?

choices.label: On average, the height of a child is <math alttext="80%" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>80</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> of the age of the child.
The least-squares regression line of height versus age will have a slope of <math alttext="0.8" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.
The proportion of the variation in height that is explained by a regression on age is <math alttext="0.64" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.64</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.
The least-squares regression line will correctly predict height based on age <math alttext="80%" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>80</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> of the time.
The least-squares regression line will correctly predict height based on age <math alttext="64%" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>64</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> of the time.

content.answer: The proportion of the variation in height that is explained by a regression on age is <math alttext="0.64" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.64</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.
